value: Hwy 36 & Loop 322. American Eagle provides service to Dallas/Fort Worth.
. Between Fort Worth and Weatherford, I-30 ends. Continue West on I-20 towards Abilene. Time: between 2 1/2 and 3 hrs, depending on traffic and where you start.
: Take US-277 North to Abilene. Time: about 1 1/2 hrs.
, there US-84 mirdges with I-20. Continue on I-20 East until US-84 brakes off of I-20 and continue on US-84. Time: about 3 hrs.
: Take I-10 West to Comfort. At Comfort, use exit 523 and take US-87 North to
. In Brady, take US-283 North to Coleman. In Coleman take US-84 to Abilene. Time: 4 hrs depending on traffic.
File:Texas & Pacific Depot, Abilene, TX IMG 6262.JPG
content=Fifth largest zoo in the state.

content=This historic depot was built by the Texas & Pacific Railroad in 1910. In 1967 the last passenger train left the depot with a total of 39 passengers on board. In 1994 the exterior of the depot was restored to its exact appearance during the 1920s. The depot is currently the home of the Abilene Convention and Visitors Bureau and Cultural Affairs Council. Admission is free.

content=At the Expo Center of Taylor County, 1700 Highway 36. A unique 4-day event held in early May to preserve western heritage. Includes a ranch rodeo, a chuckwagon cookoff, a bit and spur show, cowboy poetry, western art show, and a western parade.
directions=Take Judge Ely Blvd north from Business 20. ACU will be on your left just north of EN 16th street.

content=Expansive and well-maintained campus. Unique and beautiful architecture mixes with a large number of artworks. A 1.86 mile walking trail encircles the campus. Various theatrical, musical and athletic events occur throughout the year.
content=Founded in 1891, HSU is a private Baptist liberal arts university. With a small, beautiful campus, HSU is worth a peek.
content=Founded in 1923, McMurry is a small, tightly knit community of students and educators. Located in Abilene's bustling south side.
directions=Take Buffalo Gap Road (FM-89) south for 9 miles and follow the signs
price=Adult: $5 Senior/Military: $4 Students (K-12): $3 Children under 5 yrs: FREE
content=Abilene's newest and largest theater. All stadium seating.
content=10-screen theater inside the Mall of Abilene. Recently renovated, all stadium seating. Great bar/restaurant located next door for easy post-movie lounging.
content=6-screen theater, recently renovated. All stadium seating.
content=3 museums under one roof: an art museum, a history museum and an interactive children's museum spread out over the three floors of the beautiful former Grace Hotel built in 1909.

content=Beautiful art-deco theater built in 1930 by H.O. Wooten whose namesake skyscraper looms overhead. The Paramount plays host to a slew of theatrical and musical productions as well as screenings of both classic and contemporary films. The 2,000 seat auditorium is built to look like an outdoor Spanish courtyard, complete with twinkling stars and drifting clouds on the ceiling.
name=National Center for Children's Illustrated Literature

content=A small but wonderful museum showcasing the works of children's authors and illustrators. The NCCIL ("nickel") has played host to everyone from the Bernstein Bears to the works of Eric Carle. Exhibits are rotational and admission is free. Just one block from the Grace Museum.
price=$8 Adults, $6 seniors & military, $5 students & teachers
content=Expansive new historical museum in eastern downtown Abilene, focusing on west central Texas' frontier days. Headquarters of the Texas Forts Trail. Not to be missed.
content=Anchored by JCPenney, Sears, Dillard's, Best Buy and Books-A-Million. Home to dozens of smaller specialty clothing and gift stores and restaurants.

content=Anchored by Bed Bath & Beyond, Ross, Old Navy, Petsmart, Michael's and Beall's. Also home to The Children's Place, James Avery, Shoe Carnival, Rue21, Catherine's, Lane Bryant, Payless Shoes, Oreck, AT&T, Red Robin, Coldstone Creamery, Gamestop, SportClips, Smoothie King and several others. Wal-Mart is at the same intersection and Kohl's is just down the street.
content=Decent Chinese fare with large portions.
content=Good Tex-Mex. Try the no. 8 combo.
content=Famously good steaks. Voted best burger in America by the Today show in 2009. Catered several of President Bush's events.
content=Wonderful and well-priced casual fine dining in the heart of downtown.
content=Fine Texas Dining: unsurpassed atmosphere and wonderful waitstaff coupled with delicious food and potent drinks.
content=The College-town burrito joint inside United Supermarkets. Try the local improvement on Chipotle. Go for the seasoned chips and Spicy Ranch. Ask for the Kid's Burrito, its plenty big.
content=Located inside the impressive MCM Elegante Suites, Remington's is a popular local hotspot.

content=The small, dimly-lit bar in Seafood Tavern feels more like a British pub than a west Texas saloon. With live music regularly and a large and comfortable outdoor area, The Tavern is a great place to unwind.
content=Cheap beer, shot specials and a slew of massive projector screens and TVs playing sports and music all night, Slim's is a great hangout.
content=With a hole-in-the-wall feel, Linda's has 2 pool tables, loud music and cheap drinks. Regularly standing-room only on weekends. Very popular with the local college crowd.
content=Very popular sports bar. Full menu at all hours.
content=Located in the Mall of Abilene next to Premier Cinema. Live music most weekends.
content=Expansive sports bar with pool tables, darts and numerous TVs.
content=Across the street from Abilene Regional Medical Center. Convenient to US 83/84 and Lake Kirby, Fairway Oaks Country Club and entire southern medical district.
content=Convenient to Universities & Hendrick Medical Center.
content=Quaint, quiet and comfortable hotel just across from the Mall of Abilene.
content=Everything you have come to expect from Hampton Inn in the heart of Abilene's shopping district. Located just west of US 83/84.
content=Recently constructed just off of I-20 in far north Abilene. Extremely convenient to HSU and ACU, Hendrick Medical Center and the airport.
content=One of Abilene's newest hotels, the HGI is in the heart of Abilene's commercial district. With large rooms, convention space and an indoor pool, it has everything you could ask for.
content=Located just off of I-20. Convenient to Wal*Mart, ACU, HSU, Hendrick Medical Center & Airport.
content=Just off of US 83/84 convenient to Wal*Mart and shopping & dining.

content=Originally built as an Embassy Suites, MCM Elegante remains Abilene's premiere hotel. Lovely 2-room suites, a full-service restaurant and amble meeting space. Directly across from the Mall of Abilene and very convenient to all major highways and venues.
content=Located on I-20 in Abilene's newest commercial hotspot, the Residence Inn is barely a year old. Extremely convenient to ACU and HSU as well as the Abilene airport.
, north of town, is a popular lake for sport fishing.
